bibl.title: Newspaper clipping, The Havana Post, June 25, 1900

div1.head: Newspaper clipping, The Havana Post, June 25, 1900
div1.p:
One of the best pieces of work which
has been done under the direction of the
United States army officers at Que-
mados is the operating room at the post
hospital. This building was erected
under the direction of the post surgeon,
Dr. Stark, out of the insular funds. It is
complete in all its appointments, is
bnilt of brick, with the finest kind of tile
floor, and is supplied with all known
operating fixtures. It was built in a
substantial way so as to turn it over to
the civil authorities when the troops
leave Cuba.
